Work. Deadlines. Reasonings. Questions. Common Courtesy. Respect. Sacrifice. Trust. And You, Baby. Fuck You.

RESPONSE Did I have something between my teeth? Was my hair out of place. Were my words too big, too foolish a waste of paper, maybe? There were no comments no after class acknowledgments. Just 28 watch—watching lemmings waiting for their dinner bell. I make their world beautiful and they scoff at me. No wonder so many poets kill themselves.

“MY LOVE” Like a thief in the night I steal a glimpse of the master’s gentle hand at work. With the tip of my finger I follow the rigid cut of the jaw, mouth, chin. Pausing upon the lips to caress; with the intimacy of mother and infant All the while learning, memorizing, abducting— a small piece of him to have as mine alone. And as a child slowly loses Innocence, he will never even realize that it is gone.

My garden is much like me Everywhere you look—something different grows It’s sporadic and changing Green without bloom No form and no reason Not one portion more beautiful than the next As a whole It’s strangely understandable But just over the fence Something red is in bloom Mocking Color on the skyline And I can see it from my garden It stays in its space Never accidentally spreading color to my world And it seems better somehow More enjoyable More pleasing to the eye I could try to plant those flowers In my garden But they would not grow They would be smothered and hidden By the ones there before Green on top of green And no one would ever know That something deep down in the madness Had once tried to grow

MOVE ME Where I live words cut like ice through the warmth I once had, piercing the skin, and burning the heart like colored paper. You melt the ice and set a pleasant fire to my skin searing away the pain that slashes at my face…hands…heart. If only I had known the ease in which I would give into your stalking fire, willing to bear the pain for one more moment. My mother used to sting me with memories of her white picket fence, flowered wallpaper, and the storm. But here, I can smell the peace in the autumn leaves, see it in the dried corn, taste it in the air; and I am dizzy with it. Nothing would please me more than to hold that feeling in my cold white hands, and stroke it, keep it, live from it. These hands. But everything runs like water through those tiny cracks and crevices leaving these hands empty and dry. Where I live the words cut like ice killing me slowly, piercing my skin, and watching my heart turn to cinders.

LIFE 101 She nods and smiles while the learned one talks, as if she is the one who knows all. And I am disgusted by it— disgusted! Oh! God! Why am I disgusted? Then there is that one who is mismatched in mind and body and talks too much in large words to say very little of nothing. There is no one for her to talk to at home. The disgusting one speaks again. And right here. He sits too close to me and his hands and shoes wear the same Earth. Dirt. He is cocky without justification. Is that a tan or a dusting of filth? I’ve heard that voice before. The one that fills the same chair week after week. The one forgotten, or simply ignored, until the next time—Ahah! Remembered. The disgusting one alleluia’s the preaching. I need a cigarette but that voice in my head, the one that I live with during the week, yell No! softly to my youth. The spirit moves the learned one through flailing arms and babbling tongues. Somewhere in the midst of all those words is sense. Yes. My posterior is numb from this mechanical resting, going, resting, going, Stop for a minute please, God? I think I dropped my mind a few miles back.

A LETTER TO A FRIEND IN NEED… “I’M LEAVING YOU!” I’m off to dance amidst the moonbeams; to and fro 1..2..3..1..2..3 dodging mother nature’s guests on the dried corn adorned ballroom floor. Please don’t ask me for a waltz, my dance card is full. And please, do not try to buy my favors with a song I have listened to this night orchestra too long, not to recognize your requests. It’s probably best if I leave. And if by chance I should see a F A L L I N G star, well then – I may wish that I never see you again.

…ANOTHER MAN’S TREASURE I crave that pleasure today, but no longer does it exist in my world. It was long ago banished from the land—by the loud, yellow ensconced palace guard. I often say, they’ll rue the day they killed the Queen; but the pawn, and rooks, and gentle brooks have forgotten, and I only a child then, (and now maybe) must recall for all the minstrels far silent song. It was my palace, my passion; and I loved whole hearted and without reservation. With my youth-blind eyes I overlooked the missing puzzle pieces of the tapestry strewn corridor, filling in the time worn gaps with playful fantasy, and hidden secret colored pictures. I drank the tangy sweet nectar that was offered each visit, from the tall green whispered stemmed goblets; that climbed sleekly through my small hands like the ivy that ran down the wind chipped gables. I dreamed days away beside the earth filled wishless well, watching the clouds change from monsters, to heroes in the blink of a mind. And in the blink of a mind, I found me chasing the seeds that once sowed themselves. Wondering if there ever was a patch of purple irises, and if the morning ever gloried like it does in that dark place behind my eyes. The fable changed and there was no one left to climb the paint flaked lattice—except a slowly wilting rose of mourning. So I plucked it from it’s journey all the while becoming pricked by it’s sprit. For a moment we shared a lifeline, until I pressed it neatly into a leather bound volume of A Catcher In the Rye and slowly—gently—turned the page.

A LIGHT FOR THE DARK ROOM The door is shut, I have gone to the dark room. You will not be there only myself and the haunted past. I am at the point of full disclosure. I must clear my mind and body. Too much. Too soon. The words have stopped like a damn at a floodgate. I fight to find them as they once were sleeping softly in my brain waiting for my gentle nudge. They slumber elsewhere now. Did someone take them or did I leave the window open? I am afraid of what is to come My body is sick of me and my soul followed the words trail. I feel nothing and it is a cruel, hard notion. It slaps me in the face and opens my mouth for infinity. I only wish to stop it, but I haven’t really a care to do so. From where will inspiration spring? Not Love—for I have that. Not Pain—I have that. Not morning, noon or night— Not starry skies, wild oceans, simple pleasures. Not smiling faces, open books blank pages are just pages I have them all. Nothing. I am so angry—inspire me. I must cry—give me something. To all the heavens and their powers I plead No spells or scented candles bring it back Not this time. What have I done Where did I lose that Child that Friend is it truly just someone else’s treasure Deep sleep please find me. Sweet words search my heart Dry pen and fingers fill those empty pages and leave my mind alone. A light for the dark room.

A CHILD IN VERONA When once upon a time still once uponed, in fields of endless spring time passion fashion, I happened to cross paths with Magicals’ spawn in mornings dew and daylights dawn she looked my way, awe struck me wild to meet an innocent woman child. Her hair it was set on gossamer wings hindered by golden fairy sprites, that by chance would dance upon the breeze rendering me a paintless painters insight. Those eyes I will soon not forget if tomorrow begins forever. I’m a prisoner ensconced in cobalt’s hue an untimely loss in never never. She bid me stay and enjoy the day with all her charm and wisdom. We would excuse the hours making flower crowns for royalty long lost to here after. Speaking of kings and worldly things, of oceans, motions, and logic; poetic vices, body lices, knights and ladies endeavored to whom and what and whether. She chilled me, thrilled me with her mind for I was once that young. The world was neither flat nor round but within my hand at my uninhibited commanding demand. I saw it spinning there in her palm held fast by her youthful balm. For her to turn and topsy turv, to spin and wreak and plunder to take, to leave, rejoice, or grieve to cower at her power and no other. Mother Nature feel me smother. She sang a song of love, long lost heartfelt, but not yet heartfelt. She quipped a gibe and laughed besides, never knowing the truth in life’s long strides. I wept, I mourned, and screamed and cried, but before my mouth my feelings died. Holding back the tide of knowing tears daunted by my lengthy years I left her there long ago. I’ll not soon forget the day if yesterday was the end of never; until once uponed are once uponed and happily ever’s forever.

The closing was the most dreaded of home buying experiences. All of my friends, who are already homeowners, warned me of the hours and millions of signatures. In all actuality, it went rather well. It only took 45 minutes. The people were extremely nice. And, I don't think there were that many papers to sign. The only one that freaked me out was seeing that my loan would be over in 2034 (won't we all be driving hover crafts and living on the moon by that time). And, if I only make the minimum payments, I will end up paying for my house about four times over, with interest. But, the closing is of no concern to new home buyers. You are fulfilling a dream and receiving keys to your new home. What could be so bad. Plan for some kind of celebration after the close and it will go by all that much faster!

Before painting, one of the professional tips is to go around all the door/window facings, trim, etc and caulk. This way, when you paint, there are no cracks. Everything looks seamless and it will really make the rooms look better. So, no big deal. Run a line of caulk around the seams. Smooth it out with your finger. Doesn't sound too difficult, huh? Well this chore became the BIGGEST pain in the ass of anything I have ever done. First of all, for those of you virgin caulkers...You cut off the tip of the caulk tube, do this at an angle. It will help tremendously. But...wait. You're not ready to use your caulk yet. For some unknown reasons there is an additional inner seal in the caulk. So, you have to push a big nail, screw, pencil or anything pointy down the hole you've just created and puncture that seal. If you don't, the tube will explode when you put it in the caulk gun and try to use it. EXPERIENCE TALKING HERE!!! So that was my first homeowners mistake. And, this shit is sticky. It may be a good professional tip and I did go ahead and finish the rooms with caulk. But it was like icing a cake with my pinky. Sticky, gross, messy and in the end I don't really know how much of a difference this will make. Good luck!
